tweet: I was briefed earlier by the administration on the situation in #Venezuela. We continue to support Interim President @jguaido and his constitutional government, and urge Maduro to do what is right and step down.

Senator Lugar was a truly good man and colleague. A former chairman of the Senate Foreign Relations Committee, he made the world a safer place with his efforts on nuclear nonproliferation. Dick and his family are in Vicki’s and my thoughts and prayers.

Vicki & I have been fortunate to attend mass at Notre-Dame Cathedral w/ our grandkids & sons over the years. The scene from Paris today is heartbreaking. We pray for the first responders & all others in harm’s way working to end this horrific fire. pic.twitter.com/p60Yt48sIN

We also advanced a noteworthy resolution commending our friend & ally Canada for upholding the rule of law in response to the US’ extradition request of a Huawei executive, & expressing concern about the Chinese government’s actions in response, including the continued...

I am particularly pleased to see the NATO resolution that I coauthored with a bipartisan group of colleagues advance to the Senate floor. As we will tomorrow mark the 70th anniversary of the alliance, it is an excellent time to affirm our commitment to NATO and our allies.

The committee moved General John Abizaid & Ambassador Matthew Tueller one step closer to confirmation. We badly need their representation in Saudi Arabia & Iraq, respectively, and I am glad that we have moved them forward.

I am pleased that our committee was able to come together today and vote out a sizable number of @realDonaldTrump's nominees, as well as 7 very important resolutions. We made great strides in staffing up the @StateDept. Full statement: https://www.foreign.senate.gov/press/chair/release/chairman-risch-applauds-committee-passage-of-23-nominees-seven-other-pieces-of-legislation …

"Looking back and remembering the accomplishments of NATO is important. NATO remains the preeminent political-military alliance in the world. Together, we worked to defeat the Soviet Union and usher in decades of peace and prosperity for Europe."

"Former Soviet-bloc countries clamored for NATO membership not only protection against Russia, but for the economic strength that membership could foster. U.S. trade with our fellow NATO members remains key to our economy."

"NATO has proven not only to be a military success, but a political and economic one. For its members, NATO’s security umbrella has provided the kind of stable environment necessary for economic growth and investment."

For 70 years, "NATO has remained an important piece of the framework that supports our collective security." https://www.foreign.senate.gov/press/chair/release/chairman-risch-opening-statement-at-nato-hearing …
